It's a family affair--Adolph Ochs' great-grandson, Arthur Ochs Sulzberger Jr., became its publisher in 1992
A career was born in 1955 when Esther Lederer took over the Ann Landers column of this city's Sun-Times
Now web only, this paper founded by Mary Baker Eddy features only one religious article per issue

It grew out of the Iowa Star, begun in 1849

Most of Texas' rivers flow directly into the Gulf of Mexico, but the Pecos River flows into this border river
To distinguish it from another river, "of the North" is usually added to the name of this river that flows into Canada
This river whose name is from the Dutch for "hidden river" once supplied Philadelphia with its drinking water
If you park by this 670-mile river in Montana & Wyoming, you're beside the longest undammed river in the lower 48

Since his real last name was Jenkins, Elizabeth Taylor could have been Mrs. Jenkins twice
This real first name of Mia Hamm is also the first name of an actress-granddaughter of Ernest Hemingway
The actor born Craig Bruderlin changed his name to James this; his son Josh uses the name as well
After an appearance with Lou Ferrigno, Terry Bollea took this new name for his wrestling career
He got his name in utero after he kicked his pregnant mom as she was looking at a da Vinci painting
The name of this West Indies island comes from an Arawak word for "land of wood & water", mon
This state's record low is 12 degrees; its January average is a balmy 68
"Dive" into this Mexican port & resort city on the Pacific coast officially founded by Spaniards in 1550
Cannes is a chief city in this region, the eastern end of the Mediterranean coast of France, named for its blue sky & sea
This island is spelled with a double "A" if you're talking about the Dutch part, with beaches like Guana Bay
In 1599 a syndicate headed by actor Richard Burbage built this theatre
By the time this circumnavigator reached the Pacific in August 1578, only his flagship remained of the 5 that left England
In 1598 Thomas Bodley began rebuilding this school's library with his own money & books
